trans-unit.source: Indicates that an application settings property has a special significance.
Certain application settings properties have a special significance that alters the way in which their associated settings provider should process them.
The <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute> is used to identify such properties.
This class uses the <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSetting?displayProperty=fullName> enumeration to indicate what special category the property belongs to.
<xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute> can only be applied to the settings class or to the individual settings property.

For an example of how a settings provider deals with the <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute>, see the <xref:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider.GetPropertyValues%2A> method of the <xref:System.Configuration.LocalFileSettingsProvider> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute"></xref> class.
Gets the value describing the special setting category of the application settings property.
The <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute.SpecialSetting%2A> property is set in the <xref:System.Configuration.SpecialSettingAttribute.%23ctor%2A> constructor of this class.
A <xref href="System.Configuration.SpecialSetting"></xref> enumeration value defining the category of the application settings property.
